section.title: Secure Netrc Files
section.para:
Restricts .netrc file permissions to owner read and write access, which prevents others from gaining access to this information. The .netrc files are used for remote login without interaction. This is achieved through storing an unencrypted password in the file. If used, these files should be protected from all other users. .netrc
password
The use of .netrc files is strongly discouraged. If this breaks a third-party application, undo the operation and encourage the third-party vendor to provide a better solution.

listitem.para: CC-3 - Secure Configurations for Hardware and Software on Laptops, Workstations, and Servers
GEN002000 - There must be no .netrc files on the system.
GEN002060 - All .rhosts, .shosts, .netrc, or hosts.equiv files must be accessible by only root or the owner.
RHEL-06-000347 - There must be no .netrc files on the system.
